intro: Isonandra lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved isonandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
